Keep an eye on road and wilderness closures near Central Oregon due to #wildfire. 

Mt. Washington, Santiam Pass, and McKenzie Pass are affected.  

https://t.co/blqeNT1K62

One of the biggest challenges businesses faces during a wildfire is employee #communication. 

Read our blog post for the top strategies you need to know to keep your people and your business safe during #wildfire season.  https://t.co/5S4nUqBVXN

The Triple I Insurance Blog (@iiiorg) reviews California's efforts to combat wildfire risk asking an important question. Is the state of California taking #wildfire #risks seriously enough?

There have been > 39,000 wildfires in the US this year.

Utility equipment failure & poor vegetation management is a major cause of these deadly events.

Read how Utility orgs are curbing their impact on #wildfire ignition & how #dataintegration can help.
https://t.co/cH2EbZmYU8

In total, we have mobilized 54 firefighters, 16 engines, 
 and four water tenders. These firefighters will be on the ground to help protect life, homes, and other buildings. #Wildfire #Oregon #ReponseReadyOregon

Our office has mobilized four structural task forces and our Red Incident Management Team to the #MiddleForkComplex in Lane County. These task forces are from Clackamas, Lane, Linn, and Marion Counties. (📸 Tangent Fire) #Wildfire #Oregon https://t.co/EIxhj9jpAV

Current #SJ #AirQualityIndex=52/moderate. The #ashes & #micropollutants from #CA's largest ever #wildfire, current #DixieFire blew/is blowing particles all over patio items. Also my voice=hoarse from #pollutants. Awful.
https://t.co/g6rayNiNgv

Now the warming climate is increasing the risk of major #wildfires across America.

#US scientists have reported an outbreak of “smoke thunderclouds,” which are a result of #wildfire smoke. 

Smoke thunderclouds produce lightning rather than rain and are particularly dangerous because of their ability to spark new wildfires as they move. https://t.co/LlkrIdVs3f https://t.co/uSXVuJZQML

El #Dixiefire , ahora el segundo más grande #wildfire en #California historia del estado, ha quemado más de 463,000 acres y destruido más de 400 edificios.

 Las autoridades advierten que podrían pasar varias semanas más para contener el monstruoso incendio. https://t.co/Y7PeloQ208

The #Dixiefire, now the second-largest #wildfire in #California state history, has burned more than 463,000 acres and destroyed more than 400 buildings. 

Officials are warning that it could take several more weeks to contain the monstrous blaze.

More at https://t.co/lrDM5SFOjo https://t.co/Bnzt63Edx0

Climate change cannot wait another minute!
The #Dixie fire is now the 2nd-largest #wildfire in #California history, destroying more than 400 homes and commercial buildings. Sympathy to all the affected and pray for everyone’s safety.
https://t.co/xcbEyMtPd9
